name: Interesting World History Quiz | History | 10 Questions

questions.text: According to legend, who cut the 'Gordian Knot'?
questions.explanation:
Alexander the Great.

	The story goes that whoever untied the knot would become a great conqueror and ruler.

questions.text: Which is NOT a Mayan city?
questions.explanation:
Macchu Picchu.

	Macchu Picchu is an Incan city.

questions.text: One of the Seven Wonders of the World was a lighthouse that was located in:
questions.explanation:
Alexandria.

	Rhodes was the {Colossus;} Babylon was The Hanging Gardens.

questions.text: The Maginot Line separated France from:
A famous poem describes the plight of 'Evangeline and the Acadians'. The poem was based on the expulsion of the Acadians from what part of Canada?
'El Cid' is a legendary Spanish hero. When did he live?
The Somme, Verdun and The Argonne were battles in what war?
questions.explanation:
World War I.

	They were all bloody battles of WW I.

questions.text: Which statement is true of the infamous Captain Bligh?
questions.correct: He sailed with Captain Cook prior to becoming captain of the Bounty
options: After the mutiny, he successfully navigated the open boat back to England
He never returned to the Tahiti area after the mutiny
questions.explanation:
He sailed with Captain Cook prior to becoming captain of the Bounty.

	He did sail with Cook. He took the open boat to safety, landing at Timor - not England. He did return to Tahiti. His career was not {destroyed;} he ultimately became an Admiral.

questions.text: The assassination of this African leader in 1961 sent shock waves through the entire continent:
questions.explanation:
Patrice Lumumba.

	This occurred in the region that was then called the Belgian Congo.

questions.text: The Mau Mau rebellion was another disturbing event in 20 century Africa. Where did it take place?
questions.explanation:
Kenya.

	The Mau Maus are in Kenya.
